Define the function f(x) = (x^2 + 2) / sqrt(x^2 + 1).
Differentiate the function f(x) to find its derivative f'(x).
Set f'(x) = 0 to find critical points of the function f(x).
Analyze the second derivative f''(x) to determine the nature of the critical points (whether they are minima, maxima, or neither).
Evaluate f(x) at the critical points to find the minimum value.
Determine the behavior of f(x) as x approaches infinity or negative infinity to ensure that no smaller values exist in these limits.
Conclude the smallest value of f(x) by comparing values at critical points and as x approaches ±infinity.
